dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: Seated on the edge of the made bed, Black Business Suit shifts uncomfortably as she lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK BUSINESS SUIT
dialogues.text: I was in Chicago on business, a little over a year ago. I was out.to dinner with one of our Chicago partners,.a man named Holloway. That's how I met him. TIGHT ON JONATHAN as we SMASH TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slightly older man Across from him sits Black Business Suit. A YOUNGER MAN s into frame, rests his hand on Holloway's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK BUSINESS SUIT
dialogues.text: At first I assumed he was a junior executive at their firm. But he wasn't. That's not to say he didn't work for Holloway, but clearly in a more intimate capacity...

dialogues.speaker: TNT. THE MICHELANGELO
dialogues.text: Black Business Suit takes a cool drag on her cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK BUSINESS SUIT
dialogues.text: I wasn't shocked. Besides, obviously I'm no prude. Even back then, I'd been doing - you know, this thing -- for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wyatt is talking, entertaining his two companions - but clearly more focused on Black Business Suit, flirting it

dialogues.speaker: BLACK BUSINESS SUIT
dialogues.text: I was simply curious. More so when he apologized, explaining that he'd forgotten about another engagement. Wyatt's knuckles just barely stroke Black Business Suit's thigh as he rises to leave. They exchange a knowing glanc (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BLACK BUSINESS SUIT
dialogues.text: I was intrigued. He was intelligent, informed about everything from law to art to politics. I'd never met anyone so in command of his own charm. He said that he'd come from nothing, that everything he learned, he learned from his tricks. He claimed that Holloway was even grooming him for a position at his company. She lights another cigarette with her old one.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK BUSINESS SUIT
dialogues.text: In a way, I felt for him. But I also admired him. It sounds silly,. but he had a way of making me feel - close to him, you know? This clearly hits home with Jonathan. He barely nods.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK BUSINESS SUIT
dialogues.text: So I found myself telling him things.. Personal things. And, next thing I knew -

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: You told him. About this. A beat, and she nods, crushing out her other cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK BUSINESS SUIT
dialogues.text: He seemed fascinated by it. Wanted to know all the details. (EXHALES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose I'd had too much to drink. And I was distracted... I was thinking about what a great lay he was going to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wyatt and Black Business Suit go at it with animal aggression. She's on all fours, arching lustily, pleasure nearly unbearable, eyes clenched shut as she climaxes. Exhausted, her body goes limp. TILT UP to his face: an eerily blank, driven stare, devoi real pleasure. She struggles, tries to protest - when his hands grip her shoulder blades, thrusting harder, violent pinning her down, her sudden fear stifled by the mattress

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Black Business Suit staring off, chilled by memo (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BLACK BUSINESS SUIT
dialogues.text: Only afterwards I discovered two of my credit cards were missing. As was my cell phone. Of course I couldn't say anything to Holloway. And Jamie must have known I'd never report it to the police. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I just put the incident out of my mind. I all but forgot about it, until one night, maybe two months ago -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black Business Suit is crossing the lobby for a portrait Hearst and A SUITED MAN lingering beneath it... when the looks up. It's Wyatt.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK BUSINESS SUIT
dialogues.text: I almost didn't recognize him. But when I did, I suddenly felt very, very scared. She freezes -- obscured by one of the trees as Wyatt chec his watch, scans-the lobby with a cool, piercing look.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK BUSINESS SUIT
dialogues.text: I left before he saw me. She drags on her cigarette, looks off into space.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK BUSINESS SUIT
dialogues.text: He must have used my cell phone to get into the group. (crushes out her cigarette) Anyway, that's it. That's all I know. She looks around. At the room, the bed. She shudders, ris

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Wait - thank you. (off her look) Have you ever run into him again?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK BUSINESS SUIT
dialogues.text: Getz? No. And I don't ever want to.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Getz?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK BUSINESS SUIT
dialogues.text: That was his name. Jamie Getz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bundled in her ski jacket, Solange is closing up her shop the night, stacks of flowers in her arms, when she notice Jonathan coming down the front steps.

dialogues.speaker: SOLANGE
dialogues.text: Jonathan, you're home early - Only when he looks up, she finds the young man in the overcoat isn't Jonathan. It's Wyatt.

dialogues.speaker: SOLANGE
dialogues.text: Oh - je suis desole. My mistake. Wyatt flashes her an icy smile, continues down the steps. Solange watches him walk away, a puzzled look on her face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huddled over a computer, Jonathan typing, eyes red from exhaustion and stress as we hear his recall:

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: who's James Getz?

dialogues.speaker: WYATT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: A guy I roomed with freshman year at Princeton. on Jonathan's monitor we see he's on a web site for Princ University alumni. He types in: Getz, James. A beat - then: "No match." A long list of G names follows Jonathan scrolls down the list, but there's no Getz.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Shit. Jonathan exhales, about to log off - when a name among th H's jumps out at him: Holloway. Reed. Jonathan stares at it tensely - then clicks on the name. "Sort no contact information available." Jonathan thinks a moment - then tries a search engine, ty "Holloway Reed" then decides to add the word "missing." An article appears. From the Chicago Tribune: "BODY OF MISSING BUSINESSMAN FINALLY DISCOVERED." A head-shot styl photograph shows a man in his early 40s whom we recognize from Black Business Suit's story. Beneath his photo, his name: "Reed Holloway." (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jonathan glances up at the Hotel employee manning the des

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Can I print this out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Porn shops and prostitutes, the streets pulsing with a sinister energy. Jonathan is pacing toward the subway, reading over the printed article.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan descends the steps to his presently deserted neighborhood. O.S. the departure of the subway train is joined by the distant.wail of SIRENS. Jonathan continues down the block, then pauses. He wrinkl his nose, smelling something. He looks up: two blocks awa thick plume of smoke is billowing up into the sky --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan bolts around the corner to find an ambulance and fire engine curbside -- a fire raging in the lower story his building! Running toward the blaze, he speeds past a BLACK BMW park across the street, engine running. It suddenly shifts int gear and peels out in a fast turn. Jonathan spins about it troubling him - but the BMW is already gone. He continues racing toward his building... The neon "FLEURS DE SOLANGE" sign crackles and sparks in flame. Through blown out windows, piles of burning flower emit what must be an awful stench. Two EMS WORKERS are loading a gurney on which Solange lay burned and half-aware, but alive, when Jonathan rushes ov She manages to open her eyes, her voice barely audible:

dialogues.speaker: SOLANGE
dialogues.text: Jonathan... He squeezes her hand as she's lifted into the ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN'
dialogues.text: (to EMS worker) Is she going to be okay?

dialogues.speaker: EMS WORKER
dialogues.text: Yeah, she'll make it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The ambulance doors SLAM shut. A hand grabs Jonathan's ar He spins

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I live here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thick smoke clouds the stairs and corridor. Suit jacket o his head, Jonathan is hurriedly escorted by the Fire Work His own door has already been kicked open, splintered at hinges. The place looks like it's been turned upside down furniture soaking wet, charred areas on walls.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE WORKER
dialogues.text: Lucky we were able to contain it somewhat. Better get your valuables together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: still in shock, he tosses random clothes in a gym bag - " on Bike" too.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (calls out) How did it start?

dialogues.speaker: FIRE WORKER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: We're not sure. Maybe a bad fuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan opens his medicine cabinet, takes out his small cannister, uncaps it to see how much money he has left. N very much. He stuffs the cannister into his pants pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan opens his old gunmetal-gray filing cabinet, then pops open his briefcase, trying to decide what to take. He finds a file marked "Bank Statements," pulls it, about toss it in his briefcase - when he stops, something about contents --- CLOSE ON THE FILE. Stuffed with paper. But not bank statements... Copies and copies of photographs of Jonatha with Simone Forester. Some we've seen, some new. Jonathan hunts through more files, his breathless nausea telling us the contents of each and every file have been swapped out with photos. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He opens another at random - and freezes: it's a photo of Jonathan and "S" walking in Chinatown. He scans through others, shots of them in the restaurant, entering the Hot Lotus... TIGHT ON JONATHAN, terrified by the horrific implication

dialogues.speaker: FIRE WORKER
dialogues.text: Mr. Messer? Jonathan gasps as he looks up to find the Fire Worker in doorway. He quickly shuts the file.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Just

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A paranoid-looking Jonathan returns with a briefcase stuf near to bursting. The tired Fire Worker looks up impatien

dialogues.speaker: FIRE WORKER
dialogues.text: That everything? Jonathan regards his minimal possessions, realizes how li evidence there is of a life. A wrenching sense of isolati

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I guess it is.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE WORKER
dialogues.text: You got someone you can stay with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sort of decrepit no-tell motel frequented by hookers junkies. Jonathan clutches his briefcase as he stares thr steel mesh at. the NIGHT CLERK.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT CLERK
dialogues.text: It's fifty for the night. Jonathan fishes out his film cannister, and parts with wh he discovers are his last three

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even more depressing than the lobby: bars on the windows, stains on the thin walls through which the faint sounds o paid sex bleed in. Somewhere a bottle smashes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Unable to sleep, Jonathan has emptied his briefcase conte onto the bed. He stares at one of Wyatt's photos of him a "S." She's smiling up at him. EXTREME CLOSE ON THE IMAGE OF HER FACE. The smile, frozen time, at once haunting and heartbreaking. He gently sets the photo down beside the Chicago Tribune article he'd printed on the unsolved murder of Reed Hollo ("BODY OF MISSING BUSINESSMAN FINALLY DISCOVERED"). His e drift to the article, and something suddenly occurs to hi FLASH ON: THE PHOTOGRAPH IN "WYATT'S.BROWNSTONE" of Wyatt with bleached hair styled in a loose spike -- IN THE ARTICLE'S PHOTO, Holloway sports an almost identic look.-His eyes move to the date of the article: "May 17."

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Jonathan on the phone, a business card in hand.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE ON PHONE
dialogues.text: Boston Police, how can I direct your call? Jonathan reads off the card Detective Russo had given him

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: number 274655. Jonathan sits in suspense, awaiting a response. Finally -

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER ON PHONE
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: You've got a case, a missing person named William Bansky. I'm wondering if you can tell me the date he was last seen?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER ON PHONE
dialogues.text: Hold a sec. (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bansky, William, last seen... May Jonathan's eyes return to the Holloway article MISSING BUSINESSMAN FINALLY DISCOVERED:), dated "May 17."

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER ON PHONE
dialogues.text: Anything else you- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: That's it, thanks. Jonathan quickly hangs up, equally encouraged and chilled the connection he's made. TILT DOWN to a post-it, on which he's scribbled: "BOSE = BANSKY = HOLLOWAY." To this he adds: "= JAMES GETZ"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of customers stare mutely up at plasma tv screens above - except for Jonathan, unshaven, suit wrinkled, fac all anxious tension.

dialogues.speaker: SAME
dialogues.text: Jonathan slides his passport through the window's metal t to the TELLER Teller examines the passport, then slides it back.

dialogues.speaker: TELLER
dialogues.text: M'kay, if you'll just swipe your ATM card. She gestures to a small punch pad to Jonathan's right.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Actually, my card was stolen.

dialogues.speaker: TELLER
dialogues.text: Mmm'kay... do you see those two taupe colored telephones over there? Just pick up either one and you'll be connected with our automated system.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: The thing is, I already used your automated system and...look, this passport's all I have left, it's the only thing proves who I am and now I'm down to like my last ten dollars here, so... Jonathan's cool is cracking. The Teller wrinkles her brow

dialogues.speaker: TELLER
dialogues.text: Mm'kay, if you press "0" on either phone? A customer service representative will -

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Give me a goddamn break. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TELLER
dialogues.text: Sir, there's no need for profanity.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (loses it) Oh no? In the last few days I've seen a woman I thought might be dead turn up alive and a woman I assumed was alive turn up dead, both at the hands of a guy about whom everything I know is apparently a lie. I've had my building set on fire, my neighbor nearly killed, and my apartment ransacked. So please forgive my language, but it's been one fuck of a week. The stunned Teller stares back at him slack-jawed.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Look, I know I'm just another face on this side of the glass, I get that. But I'm begging you, as one human being to another, please let me into your life just long enough to help me out here. Please. The Teller stares back at him a beat - and nods. She starts quickly typing into her monitor, finally looks

dialogues.speaker: TELLER
dialogues.text: I'm showing that card as having been sent out four days ago. It definitely went out. We even heeded the change of address request.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Well, like I

dialogues.speaker: TELLER
dialogues.text: Apparently you informed the bank of an address change? She swivels her monitor so he can see.

dialogues.speaker: TELLER
dialogues.text: Mr. Jonathan Messer,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS SEEN FROM THE CONVEX MIRROR OF AN ATM MACHINE: we watc from an ANONYMOUS POV Jonathan racing out of the bank.

dialogues.speaker: INT.
dialogues.text: We recognize the DOORMAN in the midst of fielding a compl by an ELDERLY TENANT with a yappy dog. Jonathan hurries t the elevators, unnoticed. INT. Jonathan emerges from an elevator. The last door on the l Jonathan tries the doorknob. It's locked. Jonathan checks under the mat. Sure enough, there's a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Utterly bare. Empty walls, expensive views, polished wood floors. Jonathan takes a wary step inside, leaning to pee around the corners. He paces cautiously through the living room. The dining a The glistening chrome and granite kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: A room as empty as the others - with the exception of a s pile of envelopes beneath a window in a far corner. Jonat slowly nears...to find it's a stack of mail. He picks up envelope -- O.S. the CREAK of a door hinge. Jonathan whips around -- no one behind him. He steps out the room to investigate. We remain alone in the empty room an excruciating beat... .until Jonathan finally steps back in, only slightly at ease. He returns to the stack of mail, picks up an envelo He reads: "Mr. Jonathan Messer 140 E. Eyes wide, he hurriedly flips through the rest of the mai all addressed to him at this address. Jonathan still staring at this mail in disbelief, when he finds at the bottom of the stack: another PHOTOGRAPH. It' "S" standing fearfully on the subwa latform across the track from Jonathan. And suddenly Jonathan is gripped wit fear, unaware of a blurred, nearing intruder...

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: Long time no see. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jonathan spins round, Wyatt's standing there with a gun. pointing directly at Jonathan.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: I have some instructions. Follow them and I might let her live.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: This should've been simpler. I frame you, you panic...

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Where is she?! A terrifying silence - Jonathan erupts:

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Goddamn it tell me what you did to--

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: Press pause on the questions and listen. The brokerage firm you're auditing is Clute Nichols. As a standard part of that audit you're temporarily privy to all client accounts as well as access codes required for transactions. At tonight you're going to skim from those accounts a total of transfer that money to an account I've established overseas.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I can't

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: I know you don't. But I do. Your passport. (brandishes the gun) Now, please. Jonathan takes it out and tosses it to him. Wyatt catches And hands Jonathan an ENVELOPE.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: It's all in there.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: It won't work - they screen for stuff like this. It'll be discovered eventually. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: I can live with eventually. I always have.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: This account overseas                                   - isn't it? A moment of tense silence. Jonathan just stares back hard a quiet beat; then:

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Why'd you pick me? Wyatt raises a brow, vaguely amused the question.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: You answered the ad, Jonathan. (off Jonathan's confusion) "Feeling all alone out there? Have a great job, fine personality and good looks to match, but no time to.meet that special someone? Help is just a phone call away -"

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: The ad - in Money magazine...

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: (GRINS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you to block that Caller ID. Of course I had to scope out a whole lot of losers before I hit the jackpot. After all, there only so many Jonathan Messers out there. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you screw with me, well - you saw what I did to that Blonde? That's kindness compared to what I'll do to your little .girlfriend. You won't even recognize her when I'm through.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Why should I believe you? Everything you told me was lies.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: Not lies, Jonathan. Foreplay. And now... now you're fucked. He grins his 'charming' grin and starts for the door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: Remember: be smart. I'll be watching you. And... feel free to take a shower, looks like you could do with one. The front door slams. Jonathan just stands there, staring shell-shocked at the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan comes out the building putting the envelope in h suit pocket. As he crosses the street a CAR HORN BLARES - WHIP AROUND find a car barrelling at us. Jonathan dives out of the wa instant before the car would have hit him. Face first in the gutter, scraped and gasping, Jonathan p up to see Wyatt's BLACK BMW speeding away.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. WORTH & BERMAN - AN OFFICE - LATE DAY A stiff guy in his late-30s is working in his office when ASSISTANT enters.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Mr. Peterson, one of the audit managers is here to see you. Jonathan Messer?

dialogues.speaker: PETERSON
dialogues.text: (PUZZLED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Well - okay, bring him back. We follow the assistant out the door, read the name stencilled on the glass "CHET PETERSON, SENIOR MANAGER." INT. WORTH & BERMAN - LOBBY Through a set of frosted glass doors we see Peterson's Assistant approach a RECEPTIONIST, who gestures across th lobby. The Assistant approaches the sofas, where Jonathan seated. She addresses him. He rises. INT. WORTH & BERMAN - PETERSON'S OFFICE Chet Peterson looks up as his door is opened -

dialogues.speaker: PETERSON
dialogues.text: Jonathan, good to see you again! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: - reverse angle to find a YOUNG MAN we've never seen befo

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Actually, I was just looking for Fred Whipple's office?

dialogues.speaker: PETERSON
dialogues.text: (AWKWARDLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next door down. The Young Man ducks out, and now Peterson sees his Assist approaching, Jonathan a few paces behind her, adjusting h glasses. Peterson reloads his greeting:

dialogues.speaker: PETERSON
dialogues.text: Jonathan, good to see you again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Chet Peterson, gravely peering across his desk.

dialogues.speaker: PETERSON
dialogues.text: Well, I have to say, your resignation comes as something of a surprise. Most of our auditors seem to like the freedom the position affords. (CONCERNED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll stay on to finish up at Clute Nichols, of course? Track around Peterson to see Jonathan seated across from lifting his head to reply - and doing so revealing it's
Wyatt," wearing one of Jonathan's suits, hair colored and styled like Jonathan's, even sporting identical eyeglasse He offers an awkward half-smile, just as Jonathan would.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: PETERSON
dialogues.text: So do you have any plans?

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm going to travel. I want to see the world. Peterson nods benignly.

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF QUICK DISSOLVES/ STOP-MOTION PHOTOGRAPHY
dialogues.text: Jonathan sitting in the conference room of Clute Nichols, lettered-boxed by the glass wall through which he watches employees pass in fewer and fewer numbers. Throughout thi Jonathan's blank stare of harrowed tension never changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abeautiful shot of the cityscape - accompanied by the sou of fingers clacking on keys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan seated at the far end of the empty table, typing his laptop. Beside him is the envelope Wyatt gave him, an its sheet of paper on which instructions are typed. Jonathan peers at the laptop clock. It reads His eyes travel in a tense triangle from instructions, to laptop screen, to glass wall - fingers typing all the whi He finally reaches a prompt: BIENVENUE. POUR ANGLAIS, CBO We glimpse a small. logo with a SWISS FLAG. Jonathan presses F2. Reads some more, types some more. Finally we read: ENTER SUB-ACCOUNT NUMBER. Jonathan enters more per Wyatt's typed instructions. Read

dialogues.speaker: ENTER DESIGNATED ACCOUNT NUMBER
dialogues.text: Jonathan copies the numbers in from the instructions. Wai

dialogues.speaker: ENTER SENDER'S 8 DIGIT ACCESS CODE. REQUIRED TO COMPLETE
dialogues.text: His eyes travel to a page atop a Clute Nichols file. We c glimpse an 8 digit code circled in pencil. Jonathan stare the cursor.on the laptop screen, the icon blinking petulantly. He's about to type... And then he halts. His eyes drifting to HIS CELL PHONE, resting in its charger. TIGHTER ON JONATHAN. His eyes fixed on the cell phone, an idea forming in his mind -- RING!! of the cell phone suddenly jars us. RING... Jonath hesitates, then picks up.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What's taking you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jonathan says nothing. We can hear Wyatt getting tenser:

dialogues.speaker: WYATT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I said what's taking you?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I wondered if you were monitoring this.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Don't worry about what I'm doing. Just finish the transaction. Now.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Not until I see her. (off Wyatt's silence) The transfer's impossible without an access code. And there's no way I'm entering it until I'm sure that she's safe. So you tell me. How do we do that? Wyatt still remains unnervingly silent. We tighten on Jonathan, holding his breath, any plan he's concocting clearly hinging on this...

dialogues.speaker: WYATT, (0..S.)
dialogues.text: (low, frustrated) You have a wireless connection? Jonathan lets out a brief exhalation.

dialogues.speaker: SAME
dialogues.text: Jonathan snaps his laptop lid shut, packs it in his gym b in which we glimpse the photo he's kept with him of "S" smiling up at him. He then turns to his cell phone once more. He picks it up scrolls the menu, punches a number.

dialogues.speaker: AWOMAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you free tonight? A sudden, jarring SOUND ADVANCE OF MUSIC as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elaborate and intensely packed WEDDING PARTY is being up here beneath the glow of heat lamps, the music and cro noise unspeakably loud. We travel through the din, past hundreds of well-heeled partiers, mainly young and wealth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party noise is even slightly audible where we find Jonathan carrying his bag as he enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan surveys the busy lobby. GUESTS mulling. STAFF bustling. And, of course, the "ELOISE" PORTRAIT.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: May I ask you a personal question? Jonathan spins around, stares frostily into Wyatt's magne smile. With Wyatt's new look, they could be brothers. Except Wyatt looks clean and crisp, Jonathan dishevelled tense. Wyatt eyes the bag in Jonathan's hand.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: In one of the rooms. Safe. (a thin smile) I got us a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAITRESS delivers a pair of drinks to where Jonathan an Wyatt are seated.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Two Macallan 25 year. Enjoy. The Waitress leaves. Wyatt raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: To friendship. Jonathan just stares back at Wyatt.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Bansky's dead, isn't he? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: He was dead when I met him. Just like you. The rest was a mere formality. (re: the laptop) Of course he didn't have your bargaining chip. Speaking of which...

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Not until I see her. She's the only reason I'm here and not at the police.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: I told you, she's in a room. Alive.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Give me the key then. Wyatt considers this, then takes out an electronic key ca and slides it across the table. Of course there's nothing the key card to indicate a room number.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: As soon as you're done, I'll tell you the room number.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Not good enough. Wyatt reaches for the key card; as he does we glimpse a handgun concealed by his suit.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: You won't let her live. You killed all the others, you'll have to kill us too.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: Hey, I like you, okay? You'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (scoffs, repulsed) You like me.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: I do, Jonathan. In my way. After all, you're my creation. I'm the one who gave you life.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Don't you get it? It was her, not you! She's the one. She gave me life! You can steal my identity, but not what's here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He puts his hand on his heart. Wyatt is startled by Jonathan's passionate outburst.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I'm weeping big wet ones for you both. Now, let's get on with it. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have all night, Jonathan. Jonathan reluctantly nods his assent. Wyatt lets go of th key card. Jonathan opens his bag...

dialogues.speaker: SAME
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON JONATHAN'S LAPTOP SCREEN as it defuzzes from sle The screen as it was, cursor blinking by the request for access code. Wyatt watches intensely as Jonathan starts to type -- the pauses, looking confused. Jonathan quickly reaches around. to the back of his lapto feels an empty jack - and suddenly turns pale.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: My wireless modem - I must have left it in the conference room. I can't get back online. Wyatt glares at Jonathan, seething.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: You stupid fuck.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I can go back there and-

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: No. (thinks, then abruptly) Get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wyatt and Jonathan crossing the lobby; they arrive at HOTEL GUEST BUSINESS CENTER, partitioned by a wall of gla Jonathan and Wyatt stand on the other side, peering in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: They don't let you use your own computer. Wyatt takes out a hundred dollar bill, gives it to Jonath

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: They will now. Jonathan takes the hundred, and heads into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty at this hour, with the exception of a sleepy-lookin EMPLOYEE. As Jonathan steps toward the desk, he takes out the hotel key card, his eyes travelling up to a clock overhead:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wyatt eyes Jonathan on the other side of the glass. INSERT WYATT'S POV: Jonathan explaining himself to the cl Satisfied, Wyatt finds a comfortable chair with a direct of the business center's glass. Across the lobby, an attractive AUBURN-HAIRED WOMAN in business attire glances over at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan is subtly slipping the

dialogues.speaker: EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: You forgot your. own room number?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I just checked in and it's been a hectic day. Look at me! The Employee looks uneasy - something about the ill-conce tension in Jonathan's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: You could just ask at the front desk. I'm sure they can-

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I really don't have time, okay? Jonathan presses the bill into the Employee's palm, peers at the clock again: the big hand clicks over to 11:30. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO WYATT IN THE LOBBY
dialogues.text: Still eyeing Jonathan. He sees the Employee hesitate, the accept the money. Wyatt looks relieved -- when his view is abruptly blocked the Auburn-Haired Woman.

dialogues.speaker: AUBURN HAIR
dialogues.text: Pardon me, but may I ask you something - personal? Wyatt quickly looks up at her, momentarily confused.

dialogues.speaker: AUBURN HAIR
dialogues.text: Are you waiting for me?

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JONATHAN IN BUSINESS CENTER
dialogues.text: The Employee finishes swiping his card through a scanner.

dialogues.speaker: EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: Room 907.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO WYATT IN THE LOBBY
dialogues.text: His view of Jonathan still obscured by Auburn Hair.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: What the hell are you -- And then he sees Auburn Hair glance unsurely at the Elois portrait, then at her cell phone's clock -- and now reali

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: Motherfucker! He jumps up, shoves Auburn Hair aside - eyes darting to t Business Center to find Jonathan no longer behind the gla just his laptop resting on the counter where he'd been standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan rushes into an elevator car just as it's about t close. He turns to find a YOUNG FAMILY riding up with him They've pressed floor 6. He presses floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wyatt arrives at the elevators - none are ready to open. furiously presses the call button, his hand hovering by h concealed gun. INT. Ding as the elevator doors open and the family step out. Jonathan is left alone, impatiently waiting for the doors close - - when his eyes land on something in the hallway: the fir alarm. He suddenly reaches out to stop the elevator door as it's about to close. INT. alarm blares to life. Pan an emergency exit stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wyatt is just about to step onto an elevator, when a crow wedding guests also start to pile in. Furious, he abandon the elevators for the nearest stairs. INT. GUESTS spilling out of rooms met by the blaring alarm... INT. . as Jonathan smashes the glass of yet another fire alarm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surveillance monitors show guests in the various hallways stairwells rushing in confusion at all angles...

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY
dialogues.text: We've got alarms on two - wait, three floors

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the party 30 stories above remains oblivious: music still blasting, the upscale throngs still partying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wyatt is bounding up the stairs, rounding the Fifth Floor - when he hears the door overhead bang open, and like a t wave a flood of guests fill the stairwell. Wyatt presses against the crush of bodies, pushing his wa the stairwell. INT. banged open by Jonathan's shoulder. The sound of the fire alarm is fainter up here as Jonatha races down the carpeted corridor, room numbers blurring p in sporadic fits Jonathan finally lurches to a halt before room 907. He takes out his key card, about to slide it in the slot when a hand grabs his forearm! He spins in panic to -- - a CLEANING WOMAN. She says something.in Vietnamese, indicating the ringing alarms.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Fire, I know - I'll be out in a minute. The scared Cleaning Woman nods and hurries off as Jonatha quickly slides the key in the slot. The light blinks gree He jerks the door handle and throws open the door to find

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - nothing. The room is freshly made up, no sign of life o than A PORNO FILM BLARING from the TV set on Pay-Per-View Jonathan's heart is pounding - where is she? He searches every corner, the bathroom, the closets. Everywhere. The sterile room taunts him - the uncreased bedspread, th neat arrangement of the complimentary stationary, the incessant moaning coming from the porn on the TV set -- Jonathan suddenly erupts, grips the TV and shoves it off ledge. It hits the floor with a crash, and sudden silence Jonathan rubs his brow, heaving in desperation -- when hi eyes land on the sleek, dark piece on which the TV was (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: resting; it's a dense, rectangular block - only when Jona taps it, he realizes: it's hollow. He immediately seizes it, yanks it from the wall... And there she is, lying face down in a lifeless heap: "S" Panicked, Jonathan rushes to her, turns her over. She loo semi-conscious, hands and mouth duct-taped. Jonathan hurriedly removes the tape, gently shakes her, terrified how lifeless she appears - - when her eyes widen, focus on his face. Before he can s anything, she throws her arms around his neck, presses he face to his chest. ГўВЂВћS., (whispers gratefully) You're alive. He's struck by these words, and nods, holding her face in hands as he kisses her urgently and gratefully.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: What do you say we stick together from now on?

dialogues.speaker: JA S"
dialogues.text: I'd like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rush of guests hurriedly descending the staircase, a seemingly endless stream of densely packed faces. Close on Wyatt jostled within the flow of the wealthy gue as he's the only one heading up. He passes the 6th floor. INT. Jonathan and "S" hurrying down the hall - Jonathan torn between a choice of two stairwells. His eyes dart from on another

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wyatt forcing his way upstream with menacing determinatio his gaze is wilder, more and more irritated by the descen mob of successful, well-dressed guests he's pushing again - when he halts, peering up through the railings' lozenge shaped opening, past a collection of hands and profiles.. .to Jonathan and "S" some three stories above. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON WYATT. As yet unnoticed by Jonathan, he remains halted on a stair, bodies squeezing past him. TIGHTER ON HIS EYES. That predatory gleam. EVEN TIGHTER ON HIS GUN, tucked carefully at his side. CLOSE ON JONATHAN AND "S" three stories above, starting t descend -- when Jonathan notices the hint of disruption i flow of bodies below. Immediately wary, he leans over the railing, but can't ge good look. He grips the railing, leans further over... an his eyes find Wyatt's staring right back up at him --

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: He's down there! I saw him -

dialogues.speaker: SIP
dialogues.text: Oh God -

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Up - we've got to go up! Clutching her arm, Jonathan and "S" turn back up, against flow of traffic. Stories above, less and less people are evacuating. ANGLE ON WYATT as he presses upward, his steely gaze even more rapacious. The crowd is thinning as Jonathan and "S" race upward as well. INSERT JONATHAN'S POV: a shaky, dizzying blur as they rac higher and higher... INSERT WYATT'S POV: from below but gaining on them, Jonat and "S". appearing and disappearing with each twist and t of the staircase... CLOSE ON JONATHAN AND "S", desperately racing upwards... CLOSE ON WYATT bounding the stairs, footsteps echoing, th staircase now empty and quiet, save for the footfall of Jonathan and "S" now... Wyatt slows his pace, leans into the railing, takes aim.. CLOSE ON JONATHAN AND "S" still hurrying up - when a shot rings out, a jolting echo clanging through the stairwell, (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: bullet missing them by inches. "S" screams, Jonathan tugs with him - when a second shot rings out, the bullet punching a den into the underside of the stairs just overhead. ON WYATT, realizing he needs a cleaner shot, taking the stairs even harder in pursuit, all merciless intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party is still at full throttle. Apparently no one ha yet told them of the alarms. CLOSE ON A STAIRWELL DOOR MARKED "EMERGENCY EXIT" as it suddenly bangs open and Jonathan and "S" spill out. They pause a moment - thrown by the sight of all the weal beautiful faces, laughing, dancing.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Come on! She grabs his hand, and they waste no time disappearing i the mass of bodies. They keep moving. Shoulder to shoulder within the swell o partiers, they fit right in - instantly anonymous not as smartly attired. BACK TO THE STAIRWELL DOOR as Wyatt enters the party, scanning the dense crowd, all senses alert. INSERT WYATT'S POV: just a mass of successful, attractive partying young men and women. There's no way to pick Jona and "S" out. Wyatt's smirk fades to an icy glare as he stalks the periphery. WITHIN THE CROWD "S" clutches Jonathan's hand, their head ducked low as they press forward... CLOSE ON WYATT, frustration gnashing at him as he quicken his pace, the idiotic enthusiasm of the crowd enraging hi sweat beading on his face -- when suddenly the music stops. Wyatt frowns., eyes dar CLOSE ON JONATHAN AND "S" glancing around in confusion -

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen, we need everyone to evacuate the hotel. This way please. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The crowd noise resumes, as the throngs begrudgingly star for the exits. ON JONATHAN AND "S," doing their best to stay concealed within the exiting crowd. Angle on Wyatt pushing his way through the crush, shoving people aside, trying to find them - - when he suddenly stops. He has an idea. He takes out hi cell phone. BACK TO JONATHAN AND "5" within the crowd - - when Jonathan's cell phone RINGS. CLOSE ON JONATHAN as his eyes widen in panic. RING... He quickly fumbles for it, tries to turn it off - but it's too late... WHIP ACROSS THE CROWD to Wyatt, grinning wider. He's spotted them. In an instant he is be lining through the packed suits. WIDE SHOT OF THE ROOFTOP as the throngs are clearing out. Jonathan grabs "S" as they duck, racing across the dark, rooftop, looking for a place to hide. They take cover behind a large venting duct near the ledg gasping to catch their breath... Stepping back, "S's" foo clinks against something: a stray iron railing post. She reaches. down for it, starts to lift it - - when Wyatt's hand darts in and grasps the other end. She looks up in terror - when Wyatt punches her violently knocking her to the ground. Jonathan rushes to her - only to be blocked by Wyatt, gripping the iron rod tight.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: Nice try back there, Jonathan. Looks like you picked up a thing or two from me. Jonathan tries to strike him - when with a lightning quic movement Wyatt whips the iron rod through the air, cracki Jonathan across the face.

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: Killer instinct, pall (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jonathan crumples, his glasses knocked to the ground. CLOSE ON WYATT as he grips the iron rod like a tennis racquet, steps into position - and brings the rod down on Jonathan with ruthless tenni strokes: Backhand! Bam! Forehand! Bam! Slice! Bam! Jonathan can barely peer up, bloody and beaten. He hears Wyatt drop the iron rod... JONATHAN'S POV: Wyatt's blurry figure hovering above sudd swoops in on us

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as Wyatt grabs Jonathan by the throat, hefts him up and yanks him back to the roof's concrete ledge. Jonathan fig to struggle free - when Wyatt jams the gun under his chin Jonathan freezes.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (GASPING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll... catch... you...

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: Me? No - no, I'm just a face in the crowd. I'm a tourist, just passing through. JONATHAN'S POV: Wyatt's face presses closer, now almost i focus as he presses Jonathan's torso back over the ledge

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: As for you, you had your fun... Wyatt presses closer, crushing Jonathan's back to the edg

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: Now we're going to go back down... INSERT JONATHAN'S HAND reaching into Wyatt's pocket, his fingers fumbling for the cell phone

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: We're going to get that laptop... CLOSE ON JONATHAN'S FINGERS blindly prodding - he has the phone now - his fingers feel for the antenna...

dialogues.speaker: WYATT
dialogues.text: And we're going to finish this, once and for - - when with all his strength Jonathan jams the cell phone into Wyatt's eye, the antenna punching into the retina. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Wyatt's grasp slips from Jonathan's collar as he stumbles back, cupping a hand to his wound as he swings his gun to Jonathan - - when with every ounce of strength Jonathan charges, Wya shot missing him as Jonathan slams him into the ledge wal seizing the momentum to turn himself - - as Wyatt falls right over the edge of the hotel rooftop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Wyatt's body plummeting down the magnificent facade, vanishing into the vastness of the city below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON JONATHAN as he crawls to the ledge, peers down i the darkness. He exhales, then turns back to "S" - to find she's right beside him, grateful tears in her e She leans into him, and he holds her tight, the two of th embraced on the precipice as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strobed reds and blues of police and fire.trucks amassed, trying to control the throngs of guests and pedestrians blocking our view of the body they're all gawking at. We travel through the confusion until we find JONATHAN AN "S" sitting side by side on the sidewalk curb, each propp against the other. The 'shock of it all is beginning to fade. He reaches int pocket and hands her 'Duck on Bike'.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Yours, I believe.

dialogues.speaker: 01S.11
dialogues.text: Thanks, Frank. She winds the toy up. They watch it make it's funny way d the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something personal? She nods. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: What's your name? "S" considers the request, then smiles gently, leans in c and whispers the answer in his ear. Jonathan gazes at her moment - whatever her name is, it must be perfect.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: So what now? She smiles up at him.

dialogues.speaker: S
dialogues.text: Well... are you free tonight? On Jonathan: treasuring these moments. He is truly free - perhaps for the first time in his life.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm free. They gaze at each other. We leave Jonathan and "S" to their privacy, pulling back they continue talking, continuing away until we're

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH A WINDOW AND INSIDE THE HOTEL ITSELF
dialogues.text: the window itself now a frame, letter-boxing the scene, people passing like fish in their tank... except for Jona and S, seated center-frame, two small figures side by sid face to face, talking intimately as we. FADE OUT.
